name: code-flattener
description: Transform your codebase into a perfectly structured markdown document - Boost AI coding assistants with full context, simplify code reviews, and share your projects effortlessly

codeFlattener.respectFlattenignore.description: Respect .flattenignore files to exclude specific files and directories from flattening

codeFlattener.highlightGitChanges.description: Highlight recently changed files in git repositories for better LLM context

codeFlattener.gitChangeHighlightStyle.description: Style of highlighting for git changes: emoji (ðŸ”„), text ([MODIFIED]), or markdown (bold)

codeFlattener.gitChangeHistoryDepth.description: Number of days to look back for changes in git history (1 = today only, 7 = last week)

codeFlattener.prioritizeGitChanges.description: Boost the priority of recently changed files in the flattened output

codeFlattener.ultraCompactMode.description: Generate ultra-compact output with aggressive minification for maximum LLM token efficiency

codeFlattener.compactModeLevel.description: Level of compression for ultra-compact mode: minimal (comments only), moderate (default), or aggressive (structure-focused)

codeFlattener.outputFolder.description: Name of the folder where flattened source code will be saved

codeFlattener.maxFileSizeBytes.description: Maximum file size in bytes for analysis (default: 10MB)

codeFlattener.maxOutputFileSizeBytes.description: Maximum output file size in bytes before rotation (default: 5MB)

codeFlattener.prioritizeImportantFiles.description: Prioritize important files (like main entry points, config files) in the output

codeFlattener.addCodeRelationshipDiagram.description: Add Mermaid diagrams showing code relationships and structure in the flattened output

codeFlattener.minifyOutput.description: Minify output files by removing extra whitespace and comments to optimize for LLMs and reduce token usage

codeFlattener.enableSemanticCompression.description: Enable semantic compression to intelligently analyze and condense code while preserving meaning for better LLM context efficiency

author: GTuritto
